comments:
Driver:  0422I 16:01 on Windows

When adding a servlet to web.xml programmatically, I got the a NPE in 
org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.internal.impl.ResourceTreeNode.addChild
(ResourceTreeNode.java. 

To reproduce the problem, in a new workspace, create a J2EE Web module 
targetting Tomcat 5.0, put a Java bean in Java Source directory, right-click 
and select "Create Web service".  However, if I repeat the scenario again a 
second time, it works with the same bean.  This tends to be an intermitten 
problem sometimes but I've seen it more than a handful of times now.

I've run into this problem at least a handful other times with the 0422i driver.

I'm still getting the problem with 0427I + latest from HEAD for wst.common, 
jst.common and jst.j2ee.  The trace is a bit different than before but I am 
getting it quite often, not everytime though.  If I dismiss the error and do it 
again, it ususally works.

I've released some simple null checks into the Resource Tree Node to make it a
little more bulletproof. The trace looks like a ComponentResource is being added
that doesn't have either a source path, a runtime path, or both. 

Can you test with HEAD and see if this is still a problem for your scenario?

I have not run into this problem anymore using 0428I or 0429I (i.e.M4).  Since 
this problem was intermitten before, it would be hard to tell for sure if the 
problem had been fixed or not.  You could resolve it as fixed and I can open 
another defect if the problem re-surface again.
Changed Version field given new release numbering.
